concise_definition: v. 相信（believe 的过去式和过去分词）

definitions.explanation_en: To hold an opinion or conviction that something is true or real, often without absolute proof; to accept something as true based on trust, faith, or personal judgment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指认为某事为真或实在，即使没有绝对证据；基于信任、信仰或个人判断而接受某事为真。
definitions.example_en: She believed him when he said he would come back.
definitions.example_cn: 当他承诺会回来时，她相信了他。

definitions.explanation_en: To have faith or confidence in the reliability, honesty, or ability of someone or something.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对某人或某物的可靠性、诚实性或能力抱有信任或信心。
definitions.example_en: Many people believed in the scientist’s theory long before it was proven.
definitions.example_cn: 在该理论被证实之前，许多人就已经相信它了。

definitions.explanation_en: To think or suppose something to be the case, often based on limited information or intuition.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指基于有限的信息或直觉，认为某事是如此的。
definitions.example_en: I believed the meeting was at 3 p.m., but it was actually at 4.
definitions.example_cn: 我以为会议是下午三点，但实际上是在四点。

comparison.analysis: “Thought”（认为）是更中性的认知表达，仅表示头脑中形成的想法，不必然包含情感或信任成分。而 “believed” 暗示了某种程度的主观确信或情感投入，常带有信念或信仰的色彩。例如：I thought it might rain（我觉得可能下雨）是推测；I believed it would rain（我相信会下雨）则更坚定。
“Trusted”（信任）强调对他人品格、意图或可靠性的依赖，通常用于人际关系或权威对象；而 “believed” 更广泛，可用于信念、事实、陈述等，不一定涉及人际依赖。例如：I trusted her with my secrets（我信任她保守秘密）≠ I believed her story（我相信她的故事）。
“Accepted”（接受）指理性上承认某事为真或有效，常基于证据或权威，但不一定带有情感认同；而 “believed” 更强调内在的认同感，即使缺乏证据也可能坚持。例如：I accepted the data as accurate（我接受数据准确）是客观判断；I believed the data was accurate（我相信数据准确）可能包含情感或直觉成分。
